If i try my utmost to practice English every day,the future of my English learning will be promising and hopeful.

如果我尽最大努力每天练习英语，我的英语学习的未来将是充满希望和希望的。

小作文-建议信

I am writing this letter to congratulate you because I have heard that you have just been admitted to Beijing University, a very good university in China.

我写这封信是为了祝贺你，因为我听说你刚刚被北京大学录取了，一个在中国很好的大学。

I think it is necessary to give you some suggestions on how to get prepared for university life.

同时，我觉得有必要就如何准备校园生活给你一些建议。

First of all, the teaching and learning environment in universities is very different from before, so you should study hard to get higher marks.

首先，大学里的教学环境与之前非常不同，所以你应该努力学习以提高分数。

What is more, joining clubs would make you open your eyes and have more friends.

另外，参加社团可以使你开阔眼界并且拥有 更多朋友。

Finally, I wish you a happy college life.

最后,我祝你有个愉快的大学生活.

大作文(大学兼职)

The bar chart above clearly illustrates the data of students taking part-time jobs in a certain university.

上面这个柱状图清晰地展示了某大学学生做兼职的数据。

To be more specific,seniors have the largest proportion,at 88.24%,followed by juniors,sophomores,and freshemen,with 71,93%,71.13% and 67.77% respectively.

更具体来说，大四学生占最 大比例，88.24%，其次是大三、大二和大一学生，分别是71.93%，71.13%，和67.77%。

There are three reasons for this.First of all, by doing part-time jobs, students can get more work experience and know which job is better for them.Thus,many seniors choose to work, so they could get a job more easily in the future.

这事有三个原因。首先，通过做兼职，学生可以获得更多的工作经验并知道哪个工作 对他们来说更好。因此，许多大四学生选择去工作，所以他们未来可以更容易地找到一份工 作。

what is more, part-time jobs may let some students solve their money problems.[Finally, students could develop interpersonal skills and learn how to be more independent by working.]

另外，兼职工作可能会让一些学生解决他们的金钱问题。[最后，通过工作，学生们可 以锻炼人际交往能力并学习如何变得更独立。]

As has been discussed above, we could draw the conclusion that with the rapid development of China, there will be much fiercer competition in the job market, and owing to all the benefits that part-time jobs may bring, an increasing number of undergraduates are going to work part-time.

综上所述，我们可以得出结论，随着中国的快速发展，工作市场中将存在更加激烈的 竞争，并且由于兼职工作可能会带来的所有好处，越来越多的本科生将会做兼职。

Dear Dolores,When-I-think-of-you,I’m-reminded of-the-beautiful plains of lowa.The distance between us is breaking my spirit.My time and experiences without you are meaningless to me.Falling in love with you was the easiest thing I have ever done.Nothing matters to me but you.And everyday I am alive,I’m aware of this.I loved you the day I met you.I love you today… And I will love you to rest of my life.

亲爱的德洛丽丝：当我想起你，仿佛看到了爱荷华州美丽的平原。我们之间的距离，使我意志消沉。没有你的时光和旅途对我来说毫无意义。与你相爱是我所做过的最容易的决定。没有什么比你更重要。在我活着的每一天我都会深深的意识到，遇见你的那天我就已爱上你，我今天爱你，余生也会继续爱你。

如果有人以你不喜欢的方法对待你，那一定是你允许的，否则他只能得逞一次—-张德芬

一见面就问你谋生方式的人，本质上是在计算对你的尊重程度—-罗素

Emotional intelligence must be about making others and yourself comfortable.If you make others comfortable,but very painful,that is not emotional intelligence,called retarded.—-Hopkins

情商一定是让别人和自己都舒服。如果让别人舒服，自己却很痛苦，那不叫情商，叫智障—-霍普金斯

你还要警惕自己内心泛滥的爱，孤独的人总会迫不及待地向与他邂逅的人伸出自己的手—-尼采

In many countries,the government helps to care for people.Governments give money to workers like doctors and nurses.Sometimes,when there isn’t enough money,more help is needed.More help is needed after an emergency, too.Volunteers give this help.Anyone can do voluntary work.Volunteers can be young or old.Many volunteers work with charities that help people all around the world.Some doctors and nurses fly thousands of kilometers to do voluntary work in another country.They work in hospitals or clinics for many weeks or months.They sometimes give vaccinations so that people do not get serious diseases.Every year in the USA,about sixty two million people do voluntary work.About 8 million volunteers are 16 to 24 year old.

You don’t Need More Than Two Years(改变自己只需两年时间)

Two years is nothing, but at the same time,a lot can be ==accomplished== in two years.You can try a sport you’ve always wanted to start, and ==become a qreat at it==.

两年时间不算什么，但在这段时间里，我们可以做很多事情。你可以尝试练习一项你一直想要开始的运动，==然后成为一名高手==。

You can start a morning ==routine==,and affect your mood and stress at a deep level.You can ==meditate== for a few minutes per day,become more self-aware and change the way you react to problem.You can start a business and make it a big success.

你可以开始定制某项早间习惯，它会从深层次影响你的情绪和压力。你每天可以冥想几分钟，这样就可以加强自我意识，提高应对问题的能力。你可以开创一项事业，并让它走向成功。

Two years is nothing and extremely easy to waste,but with small actions,==substantial== ==commitment== and consistency,you can make it count,a lot.

两年的时间不算什么，也很容易浪费点，但只要有微小的行动，实质性的付出和坚持，你就可以让它变得更有价值。

Two years being passive is a ==blink of an eye==.Two years moving towards goals every single day is ==plenty of== time.lt’s just a matter of ==perspective==.

消极度日，两年==转眼即逝==。每天有目标地前进，两年就意味着更多的时间。这仅仅是看问题的角度不同而已。

There is nothing that cannot be accomplished in two years with enough effort.

如果足够努力，没有什么事情是两年内不能实现的。

You’re not too old for the things you were dreaming of doing when you were a kid.You can still do extreme sports if you wish to.You can star playing a musical ==instrument==.You can become a photographer.In two years from now,you’ll be great at it if you really want to.

对你年少时的梦想来说，你永远不会太老。只要你想，你还是能去做极限运动。你还时能去学习乐器。你还是能成为一名摄影师。从现在起两年时间，只要你真的想要，你就能变得很厉害。

Don’t let your past ==dictate== who you are.You don’t have to be the same person you have always been.Don’t let fears control you.Don’t let the social standards ==conform== you.Age is just a number.

不要让你的过去决定你是谁。你也不必一直和以前一样。不要让恐惧支配你。不要让社会标准囚禁你。年龄只是个数字而已。

We should all ==empower== our ==uniqueness== and fight against our own limitations.

我们所有人都应赋予我们独特性，并与自己的局限作斗争。

By doing things you love on daily basis even for a few minutes,you’ll learn to enjoy the journey.

每天去做你喜欢做的事情，哪怕只有几分钟，你也会享受这个过程。

The days will become more than just a means to an end.you’ll see yourself ==evolving==.

每天会变得更有意义，不会被虚度。你也会看到自己的进步。

If you had the choice between feeling great,energetic and in a positive mood, ==versus== feeling sleepy and moody,what would you choose? It’s just a choice,which combined with small,enen tiny actions like reducing meat or alcohol consumption,or simply drinking more water, walking the stairs or biking to the office,you can do wonders.It’s not about the end goal,it’s about daily actions towards it.

如果你能选择自己感觉棒棒的，精力旺盛，乐观向上，亦或是疲惫着，喜怒无常，你会选哪一个？这就是个简单的选择，再加上小小的行动比如少吃肉或少喝酒，再或是多喝点水，爬楼梯或骑脚踏车上班，你就会创造奇迹了。这么做不是为了简单地达到目标，而是为了每天都能朝这个方向进步。

It’s also the reason why morning routines, or ten minutes daily meditation ==sessions== are bringing such great changes in terms of mood,productiviry,stress management,ect.

这也是为什么早间的习惯和十分钟的每日冥想都能带给人巨大的改变，比如情绪，生产力和压力管理能力的改善。

Replace TV shows and movies by ==documentaries== and books.==Monitor== your days more, get in control of how you spend your time.Take back the control of your health, mood and time.

用纪录片和书籍取代电视节目和电影。加强监督自己的日常，控制自己利用时间的方式。夺回你对健康，情绪和时间的掌控权。

Practice gratefulness.See the results in two years.

学会感激，两年后见分晓。

Be kind with people.Star with your family,don’t ==go mad== one more time.Stop judging,see the good in them,and remember that you love them more than anything.

善待他人，再也不要和家人==发火==。停止批判，看见他们好的那面，并记得你爱他们超过一切。

In your working life,being kind and nice can bring you more respect from people who surround you than being ==bossy== and ==aggressive==.Learn to say “No” often (for the right reasond),people will accept it more and value your “Yes” more, because your times value will increase.

在职场上，与人为善，相比发号施令和争强好胜，这会让你周围的人更尊重你。学会在正当理由下多说“不”，这样人们会更容易接受，且更看重你说的“好”，因为你的时间价值会增加。

You don’t need to be ==scary== to be respected.It’s about building trust and healthy long term relationships.Try this and in two years from now your reality will be so different.Silence your ==ego== love and trust others enough for two years, harvest for ten years or more.

你不用通过变得吓人去获得尊重。重点是要建立起相互信任且健康的长期关系。试试看，从现在开始起的两年，你的生活将会变得大不同。用两年时间去压制你的自负，去爱和信任他人，十年甚至更长的时间你都会因此收益。

It has a lot to do with setting goals.but goals without actions are just wishes.The easiest way to reach goals is through daily and consistent small (even tiny) actions.It’s all about consistency, commitment,and regularity.Success is not an event.it’s a process and a ==mindset==.

这和目标的设定有很大关系，但光有目标没有行动就只能是美好的愿望而已。最简单达成目标的方法就是，每天都坚持微笑的行动。一切都在于要建立一致性，要坚持付出和养成规律。成功不是一个偶然的时间，它是个长久的过程和心态。

Small actions are putting you in the ==position== of succeeding.Small actions make huge differences.

微笑的行动能让你走向成功的道路。微笑的行动能带来巨大的改变。

Look at yourself in the mirror in two years and you’ll think ==”that was quick”==.

两年后在镜子中看看自己，你会想“时间过的真快”。

==Every day counts.==

珍惜每一天

  • accomplish—-v.完成，实现

$\textcolor{purple}{}$

Are naps actually good for us?

午睡真的对我们有好处吗？

Are we designed to ==nap== during the day?

我们生来就是会想要午睡的吗？

Most people aim to get their recommended seven to nine hours of sleep in one long stretch at night. And the ==technical term== for this is “monophonic sleep.” In other words, ==a== single ==bout of== sleep at night.However,we may not have been programmed to sleep in this way.

大多数人励志于==在一个漫长的夜晚==达到推荐的七到九个小时的睡眠时间==专业术语==将它称为“单向睡眠（monophasic sleep)”==换句话说==，就是只有晚上的==一次==睡眠。然而，我们可能斌不是生来就以这种方式睡觉的。

Now I’m sure you’ve had that experience of a ==drop== in your ==alertness== in the afternoon, where you start to feel a little sleepy. And you can also see it in other people as well, as their heads begin sort of ==bobbing== up and down during afternoon meetings. Now you may think this afternoon drop in your alertness is because of a big lunch, but ==in actual fact==, it seems to be ==hardwired==.

我确定你有经历像是下午的时候，你的警觉性会下降，这时你开始感到有点困。在他人身上你也能看到这一点，在午后会议中，他们的头开始上下摆动。 现在你可能觉得下午的警觉性降低是由于中午吃得太多。但==事实上==，这似乎是与生俱来的。

Because if I place ==electrodes== on your head, there is a ==reliable==,==preprogrammed== drop in your brain’s alertness during the afternoon. And it happens to most of us somewhere between the one to four pm mark.

因为如果我把电极（脑电波探测）放在你的头上，下午你的大脑的警觉性会有一个可靠、预先编程的下降。==我们大多数人的大脑都会在下午1到4点感觉困顿。==

==What this suggests is that== we may have been designed to sleep in a biphasic pattern, meaning one longer bout of sleep at night and then a short afternoon nap during the day, very much like the ==siesta== cultures around the world.

==这表明==我们生来就被设定出了两个睡眠模式，也就是说晚上的睡眠时间要长一些，然后在白天小睡一会儿，就像世界各地的午睡文化一样。

But is napping always a good thing? Well, not necessarily. Although we and other scientists have discovered that naps can have benefits for both the brain and for the body, naps can be ==a double-edged sword==. Long naps in the afternoon or in the early evening can just ==take the edge off== your sleepiness. It’s a little bit like ==snacking== before your main meal.

但小睡总是一件好事吗？好吧，不一定。即便我们和其他科学家们发现了午睡对大脑和身体的好处。但午睡也是==一把双刃剑==，在下午或傍晚的早些时候长时间小睡，能==减少==你的困倦，就像是晚饭前吃零食一样。

So if you are ==struggling with sleep== at night, the best advice is not to nap during the day. Instead,build up all of that healthy sleepiness so that you give yourself the best chance of falling asleep easily and then staying asleep ==soundly== across the night.

所以如果你晚上入睡困难，建议就是不要在白天午睡，而是积攒所有健康的困意。这样你就有最好的机会轻易入睡，然后整晚都睡得很香。

But if you’re not ==struggling with sleep== and you can nap regularly during the day, the naps of around 20 minutes taken early in the day can be just fine.

但如果你没有失眠的话，有规律的小睡是可取的，每天在早些时候小睡20分钟左右就刚刚好。

$\textcolor{purple}{sammary}$

naps can be a double-edged sword, if you are struggling with sleep at night, the best advice is not to nap during the day. if you’re not struggling with sleep, you can nap regularly around 20 minutes taken early in the day.

$\textcolor{purple}{总结:}$

午睡是把双刃剑。如果你晚上容易失眠，建议白天不要午睡；如果你没有失眠，白天有规律地睡大概20分钟比较好。

极限

极限概念解题思路：
  1. $\exists N>0, n>N, \lim_{n\to\infty}x_n=A\Longrightarrow x_n=A+\alpha$
  2. $\alpha$ 为任意无穷小，可以小于任何定数，但不能和不定数比较大小
数列极限证明（单调有界准则）：
  1. 单调性
  2. $x_{n+1}-x_n$
    1. 若 $x_{n+1}-x_n=f(x_n)-x_n$，可令 $g(x)=f(x)-x$ 讨论单调性
  3. 或得出递推关系 $x_{n+1}=f(x_n)$，$f(x)$ 单调增
    1. $x_1\le x_2$ 时，${x_n}$ 单调增
    2. $x_1\ge x_2$ 时，${x_n}$ 单调减
  4. 有界性

导数

  1. $f(x)=|x-x_0|g(x)$ 在 $x=x_0$ 处可导 $\Longleftrightarrow \lim_{x\to x_0}g(x)=0$
  2. 若 $f(x)$ 在 $x=x_0$ 处连续不可导，$g(x)$ 在 $x=x_0$ 处可导，则
    • $F(x)=f(x)g(x)$ 在 $x=x_0$ 处可导 $\Longleftrightarrow g(x_0)=0$

微分中值定理证明

若涉及导数的不等式证明，如 $f’’(\eta)<-2$ 可考虑：

  1. 拉氏定理
  2. 泰勒
证明不等式和方程根：
  1. 单调性
  2. 零点定理

定积分极限定义

通解：
$$
\lim_{n\to\infty}\sum_{k=1}^nf\Big(a\cfrac{k}{n}+b_n\Big)\cfrac{a}{n}=\int_{\lim_{n\to\infty}x_1}^{\lim_{n\to\infty}x_n}f(x)dx
$$

  1. $f\Big(a\cfrac{k}{n}+b_n\Big)=f(x_k)\Longrightarrow f(x)$
  2. $x_{k+1}-x_k=\cfrac{a}{n}\Longrightarrow dx$ 即可爱因子
  3. $\sum\Longrightarrow\int$
  4. 上下限
    • 上限：$k=n$ 时，$x_n\to ?$
    • 下限：$k=1$ 时，$x_1\to ?$

积分敛散性

$\int_0^a\ln^pxdx\quad(p>0\text{ 收敛})$

$\int_a^{+\infty}\cfrac{x}{e^p}dx\quad (p > 0\text{ 收敛})$

$\int_0^\infty \cfrac{1}{x^\alpha \ln^\beta x}dx$

  1. 当 $x\to0$（瑕积分），则 $\begin{cases}\alpha<1\\alpha=1,\beta>1\end{cases}$ 收敛
  2. 当 $x\to\infty$ （无穷区间的反常积分），则 $\begin{cases}\alpha>1\\alpha=1,\beta>1\end{cases}$ 收敛

定积分应用

静水侧压力

$\text{压力}=\text{压强}\times\text{面积} =\rho ghS$，其中 $\rho$ 为水的密度，$g$ 为物重力加速度，$h$ 为物体在水中的深度，$S$ 为物体的面积

质心与形心

质心公式：$\begin{cases}\bar{x}=\cfrac{\iint_D x\rho(x,y)d\sigma}{\iint_D\rho(x,y)d\sigma}\\\bar{y}=\cfrac{\iint_D y\rho(x,y)d\sigma}{\iint_D\rho(x,y)d\sigma}\end{cases}$，其中 $\rho(x,y)$ 为密度

当密度 $\rho(x,y)=C$ 时有形心公式：$\begin{cases}\bar{x}=\cfrac{\iint_Dxd\sigma}{\iint_D\sigma}\\\bar{y}=\cfrac{\iint_Dyd\sigma}{\iint_Dd\sigma}\end{cases}$

常用公式及解题思路

$$
\int_0^{\frac{\pi}{2}}f(\sin x)dx=\int_0^{\frac{\pi}{2}}f(\cos x)dx\
\int_0^\pi xf(\sin x)dx=\cfrac{\pi}{2}\int_0^\pi f(\sin x)dx\
\int_0^a\sqrt{a^2-x^2}dx=\cfrac{\pi}{4}a^2\Longrightarrow \int_a^bdx\int_0^x\sqrt{x^2-y^2}dy=\int_a^b\cfrac{\pi}{4}x^2dx\quad (a>0)\
\int_0^a\sqrt{2ax-x^2}dx=\cfrac{\pi}{4}\
\int_0^{2a}(x-a)dx=0\quad x\text{ 关于 }a\text{ 的奇函数}\
f’’(x)>0\Longrightarrow f(\cfrac{a+b}{2})(b-a)<\int_a^bf(x)dx<\Bigf(a)+f(b)\Big\
f’’(x)>0\Longrightarrow f(\cfrac{a+b}{2})<\cfrac{f(a)+f(b)}{2}
$$

当 $f(x)$ 单调时，若题目比较两个积分大小可考虑

  1. 变上限积分 $F(x)=\int_0^xf(t)dt$，考虑 $F(x)$ 单调性来比较
  2. 将两个积分区域化为同一个积分区域，根据单调性比较
  3. 将大的积分区域拆成两份，使用拉格朗日中值定理和单调性比较
  4. $\bar{y}=\frac{\int_0^af(x)dx}{a}$ 平均值的几何意义

$F(x)=\int_a^xf(t)dt$

  1. $F(x)$ 必连续
  2. 若 $f(x)$ 在 $x=x_0$ 处连续，==则 $F(x)$ 可导==，$F’(x_0)=\lim_{x\to x_0}f(x)=A$
  3. 若 $f(x)$ 在 $x=x_0$ 处为可去间断点，==则 $F(x)$ 可导==，$F’(x_0)=A\ne f(x_0)$
  4. 若 $f(x)$ 在 $x=x_0$ 处为跳跃或无穷间断点，==则 $F(x)$ 不可导==，$F’+(x_0)=\lim{x\to x_0^+}f(x),\ F’-(x_0)=\lim{x\to x_0^-}f(x)$

补充

若 $r(A_{m\times n})=n$，即列满秩，则 $r(AB)=r(B)$

若 $r(A_{m\times n})=m$，即行满秩，则 $r(BA)=r(B)$

若矩阵有等式如：$A^2-A-2=0$，可其特征值也满足相同的等式，但取值为或

  1. 如 $\lambda^2-\lambda-2=(\lambda-2)(\lambda+1)=0\Longrightarrow\lambda=2$ 或 $\lambda=-1$，具体是几重根并不清楚
  1. 已知 $P^{-1}AP=B$，求 $B$
    • 算 $AP=PB$（代数运算）
  2. 已知 $P^{-1}AP=B$，求 $P$
    1. $P_1^{-1}AP_1=\Lambda$
    2. $P_2^{-1}BP_2=\Lambda$
    3. 则有 $(P_1P_2)^{-1}A(P_1P_2)=B$

基础解系：$\begin{cases}1.\text{ 是解}\2.\text{ 无关}\3.\text{ 个数}=n-r(A)\end{cases}$

设 $A$ 为 $n$ 阶矩阵，若 $r(A)=1$，则特征值有：$\lambda_1=\lambda_2=\cdots=\lambda_{n-1}=0,\lambda_n=tr(A)$，且 $A$ 可相似对角化

实对称矩阵只与实对称矩阵合同

$\begin{pmatrix}A&B\end{pmatrix}\longrightarrow\text{（行变换）}\begin{pmatrix}E&A^{-1}B\end{pmatrix}$

$\begin{pmatrix}B\A\end{pmatrix}\longrightarrow\text{（列变换）}\begin{pmatrix}E\AB^{-1}\end{pmatrix}$

若 $A$ 可相似对角化，即 $P^{-1}AP=\Lambda$，==则 $r(A)$ 为非零特征值个数==

解二次型需要先化标准形（配方、正交变换法）

给定二次型的正负惯性指数，求参数：
  1. 配方法
  2. 特征值
矩阵 $A^n$：
  1. 规律
  2. 相似对角化

若 $AX=0$ 的解为 $BX=0$ 的解，则 $r(A)\ge r(B)$

  1. 若 $AX=0$ 的解为 $BX=0$ 的解，但 $BX=0$ 的解不全是 $AX=0$ 的解，则 $r(A)>r(B)$
  2. 若 $AX=0$ 的解为 $BX=0$ 的解，且 $r(A)=r(B)$，则 $AX=0$ 与 $BX=0$ 同解

$AX=b,BX=c$，则 $\begin{pmatrix}A\B\end{pmatrix}X=\begin{pmatrix}b\c\end{pmatrix}$ 的解为 $AX=b$ 和 $BX=c$ 的公共解

若矩阵 $A=(\alpha_1,\alpha_2,\cdots,\alpha_n),B=(\beta_1,\beta_2,\cdots,\beta_n)$ 满足 $A=CB$

  1. $C$ 可逆，则 $AX=0$ 与 $BX=0$ 同解
  2. $C$ 不可逆，则 $BX=0$ 的解均为 $AX=0$ 的解
